DataElement.preferredName: Curie Scoring System Bone Site Outcome Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the curie scoring system number in bony sites.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Curie Scoring System Bone Site Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A semi-quantitative scoring system, developed at the Curie Institute in France, used for staging neuroblastoma patients at diagnosis and for response assessment following induction chemotherapy. Following whole-body 123I-mIBG scanning, osteomedullary involvement is scored for 9 skeletal segments plus a tenth score for soft tissue involvement._Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body._A position in relation to its surroundings._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A semi-quantitative scoring system, developed at the Curie Institute in France, used for staging neuroblastoma patients at diagnosis and for response assessment following induction chemotherapy. Following whole-body 123I-mIBG scanning, osteomedullary involvement is scored for 9 skeletal segments plus a tenth score for soft tissue involvement.

Following whole-body 123I-mIBG scanning, osteomedullary involvement is scored for 9 skeletal segments plus a tenth score for soft tissue involvement.

Property.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.:A position in relation to its surroundings.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
